article:
'Optimal maintenance' is the discipline within operations research concerned
with maintaining a system in a manner that maximizes profit or minimizes cost.
Cost functions depending on the reliability and maintainability characteristics
of the system of interest determine the parameters to minimize. Parameters often
considered are the cost of failure, the cost per time unit of "downtime", the
cost (per time unit) of corrective maintenance, the cost per time unit of
preventive maintenance and the cost of repairable system replacement [Cassady
and Pohl]. The foundation of any maintenance model relies on the underlying
deterioration process and failure behavior of the component.

Optimal Maintenance strategies are often constructed using stochastic models and
focus on finding an optimal inspection time or the optimal acceptable degree of
system degradation before maintenance and/or replacement.
